result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trayvon Gemel McGowan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Trayvon G McGowan in court.  
Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Trayvon G McGowan. 
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

.Case in court for a  Scheduling Conference.
Defense motion to withdraw as counsel at the request of the Defendant. 
Statements made by defendant. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is Granted. 
Attorney Kuehn to notify  the SPD Office new counsel needs to be appointed.    
Court red matter adjourned for Status of Counsel. Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed: Justice Point Supervision Report.

Defendant Trayvon Gemel McGowan in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and a global offer from the State and request time to review with defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Trayvon Gemel McGowan in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn; both appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer K. Brockmann. Court took judicial notice of 18CF5229 & 13CF2322.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.   
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report

Defendant Trayvon Gemel McGowan not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving at all while case is pending.

04:10 PM Defendant Trayvon Gemel McGowan in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Trayvon Gemel McGowan in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trayvon Gemel McGowan appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
